data.text: Average all inclusive family holiday. You got what you paid for. Entertainment team works so hard.. But as though they are put under pressure to do so.  Paper cups for drinks. Always something to eat. Good waterslides. Beds were all ripped... Room very basic. Done the job. Kids weren't impressed (2 teenager).... Which was part of the reason we chose this hotel.... We only went out to hotel entertainment a couple of times because the way it was set up.  Average.
data.title: Average

data.text:
Rooms are very average and need some maintence skirting boards and wardrobes need replacing, lovely pool,lovely hotel reps who kept everyone busy, food was ok but very samey.Entertainmet wasn't the best and we all had to sit on the cold stone seating area.
We visited the local beach and would walk the 15 mins there and usually catch the free bus back to the hotel. Beach was stunning please visit.
data.title: A nice break away just needs a few weeks

data.text: Great hotel although without a doubt not a 4 star borderline 3 if I'm honest,family of 4 went for 10 nights the hotel is situated in a good spot within walking distance to everything hotel staff are lovely and very helpful.Rooms are very basic and dated and most the doors are rotten at the bottom where they have been cleaned that much with solution we had mice running around the gaps under the doors are that big and the towel situation was ridiculous we either had no towels changed or feet towels in place of face towels or a mixture of whatever the maid had left it was a bit scatty,although the hotel was a bit dated we still had a good time and would go back Rhodes.I certainly wouldn't pay the nearly 7k easyjet are asking for a family of 4 in August I'd expect pay 3 amd half to 4 tops its just not worth it.
data.title: Fair assessment (just my opinion)

data.text: Arrived to a busy and tiny reception desk with one member of staff to check us all in. Wandered around with cases to find our room and immediately had a really bad impression. The route we took presented us with the backs of the rooms granted but the grass was scorched with weeds and the paint was shocking on the building! Finally found our room (block 6), as far as you could get up the hill and that’s what if asked for however there was a humungous generator outside this block of room and we had no sleep that night. With ear plugs rammed in following nights we got used to it but sitting on the balcony was over shadowed by a loud hum! Our towels when we arrived were unbelievable, wish I took a photo. Very small hand towel and what I assume was 2 bath towels which in my book were more like hand towels and were all frayed at the edges (I’ve used better towels on my dog)! That improved but not by much! The dining room was crazy so leave it till late to go! Food was cold and in the evenings only one side of a small serving area was open so very limited choice to what I’m used to from a 4star. It was so busy with families but they were smoking and very loud and the drinks, vile and served in cardboard kids party cups which made them taste even worse. I have never written a review but this hotel was SO disappointing and leaves me wondering for such a busy hotel, why aren’t they spending more on the paintwork and gardens that are not front facing and invest in decent towels and at least some decent plastic cups not kiddies cardboard cups for cocktails and drinks. Sorry Cyprotel, that’s my honest view.
data.title: Not a 4 star I’m afraid

data.text: We had the best first family holiday here. Nothing was too much trouble, the animation team and the entertainment was amazing, lots of pools, water slides and sun loungers, great choice of food, the reception and front of house staff were great - honestly could not fault this hotel, especially for the price. The kids club for 4 years and over was also very handy, we even plan on going back once my youngest is 4! They even acknowledged it was my birthday whilst I was there and delivered a bottle of alcohol to the room which was a lovely surprise. Next time we will stay for 10 days instead of 7 as it wasn’t long enough!
data.title: Best first family holiday abroad
